name: NSMutableIndexSet
desc: An object representing a mutable collection of unique integer values that bridges to IndexSet; use NSMutableIndexSet when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.

items.name: func add(Int)
items.desc: Adds an index to the receiver.

items.name: func add(IndexSet)
items.desc: Adds the indexes in an index set to the receiver.

items.name: func add(in: NSRange)
items.desc: Adds the indexes in an index range to the receiver.

items.name: func remove(Int)
items.desc: Removes an index from the receiver.

items.name: func remove(IndexSet)
items.desc: Removes the indexes in an index set from the receiver.

items.name: func remove(in: NSRange)
items.desc: Removes the indexes in an index range from the receiver.

items.name: func shiftIndexesStarting(at: Int, by: Int)
items.desc: Shifts a group of indexes to the left or the right within the receiver.
